tasks.task: Describing daily operations and challenges of a hydroponic strawberry farm
subtasks: Planting strawberries in vertical towers
Managing water and nutrient distribution in towers
Rotating pots for uniform sunlight and wind exposure
Monitoring plant health (e.g., for iron deficiency)
Evaluating different media mixes for optimal plant growth
Implementing irrigation systems (twice daily cycles)
Analyzing trial results and adjusting practices
Adapting to weather conditions (drought vs. rain)
Evaluating potential for expansion into other berries

tasks.task: Discussing the Sierra Grant and its impact on farm development
subtasks: Explaining the purpose of the Sierra Grant in addressing challenges
Detailing infrastructure built with Sierra Grant funding (e.g., end posts, high tensile wire)
Assessing the benefits of the vertical tower system (ruth ergonomics, reduced bending)
Describing the unique strawberry growing system (day neutral, annual planting)

tasks.task: Explaining plant care and harvesting schedule
subtasks: Timing of strawberry harvest (July 1st to July 20th)
Dealing with adverse weather conditions (water retention in soil)
Collecting data on media performance and plant health
Considering labor requirements and efficiency (planting speed, watering ease)

tasks.task: Describing the trial setup for different media types
subtasks: Setting up side-by-side comparisons of various media in a dedicated field
Monitoring water usage across different media treatments
Evaluating plant size and health in each media type
Assessing the need for foliar feeding and iron supplements
Determining the best media mix for future use

tasks.task: Discussing the challenges of growing strawberries in a windy location
subtasks: Setting up trellis systems to hold towers upright
Securing towers against wind movement (using ground stakes and t-posts)
Aligning rows for optimal sunlight (north-south orientation)
Rotating pots daily for even sunlight exposure and wind management
